functions.name: mount
functions.description:
Defines all the webcomponents and mounts all the Spryker components registered in the application.
Fires events according to the application status.

tags.name: remarks
tags.description:
This function must be invoked after setup() as it relies on the initial configuration.
This function should be invoked on DOMContentLoaded or following event as DOM must be loaded to mount Spryker
componets.

tags.name: event
tags.description: components-mount (config().events.mount) Fired when all components has been succesfully mounted.

tags.name: event
tags.description:
components-ready (config().events.ready) Deprecated, use `components-mount` event instead - Fired when all
components has been succesfully mounted.

tags.name: event
tags.description:
application-bootstrap (config().events.bootstrap) Fired only once, when all components has been succesfully
mounted for the first time and application bootstrap is completed.

tags.name: event
tags.description: application-error (config().events.error) Fired when an error occours during the mounting process.

tags.name: returns
tags.description: Void promise as the mounting process is asyncronous.

functions.name: setup
functions.description: Setups the initial configuration for the application and the log system.

parameters.name: initialConfig
parameters.description:
The initial configuration. Default development configuration is used if none is
passed.

functions.name: bootstrap
functions.description:
Executes the application full bootstrap.
It invokes the setup() function first and, on DOMContentLoaded, the mount() function.
It adds listeners for all the events (mount, bootstrap and error) emitted  by mount().

parameters.name: initialConfig
parameters.description:
The initial configuration. Default development configuration is used if none is
passed.

tags.name: remarks
tags.description: This is the recommended function to invoke in order to initialise Spryker Shop frontend application.
